result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole C Wampole was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with defs children if def has had any alcohol or controlled substance. Do not reside anywhere there is alcohol. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol.
Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Set FPT 30 days. Qualifies for SPD
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Final pre-trial on June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Theodore J.
- Defendant shall not be at 1342 Sunfield St in Sun Prairie, WI after consuming alcohol.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Trial Judge - Br 11

Defendant appeared.  Stephanie R Hilton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
